method.name: emulation_bgp_route_config
method.description: This procedure creates a route range that is associated with a BGP4 neighbor. It also defines the characteristics of the routes that will be advertised at the beginning of the session. It defines a set of routes and associated attributes. The routes can be unicast/multicast, mpls, vpn, and vpls.

description.text: Valid values are: BGP router handle - handle is returned by procedure emulation_bgp_config. A new route will be added when -mode is add. BGP route handle - Valid only for IxNetwork Tcl API (new api). Handle is returned by procedure emulation_bgp_route_config with 'bgp_routes' key. Valid only for mode remove. The object will be removed. BGP L2Site handle - Valid only for IxNetwork Tcl API (new api). Handle is returned by procedure emulation_bgp_route_config with 'bgp_routes' key. When mode is remove the L2Site will be removed. When mode is add a new label block will be added to the provided L2Site. BGP L3Site handle - Valid only for IxNetwork Tcl API (new api). Handle is returned by procedure emulation_bgp_route_config with 'bgp_routes' key. When mode is remove the L3Site will be removed. When mode is add a new vpn route range will be added to the provided L3Site.
The handle of the BGP route where to take action.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: The handle of the L3 VPN Site where to take action.
Specifies either addition or removal of routes from emulated nodes BGP table.

choice.choiceText: Add a new unicast, vpn or ip BGP route. Can also add L3 Sites, L2 Sites, L2 Site LabelBlocks, AD VPLS. (legacy alias)
Add a new unicast, vpn or ip BGP route. Can also add L3 Sites, L2 Sites, L2 Site LabelBlocks, AD VPLS.
Enables the given BGP route handle.
Disables the given BGP route handle.
Modify the given BGP route handle.
Remove the given BGP route handle. (legacy alias)
Remove the given BGP route handle.
Import BGP routes from a given file and also take in account some other arguments needed for successful route import
This mode will execute statistical route distribution on BGP. The api will also support the attributes needed for successful route distribution.
This mode will execute statistical IPv6 route distribution on BGP. The api will also support the attributes needed for successful ipv6 route distribution.

restriction.value: add create modify remove delete enable disable import_routes generate_routes generate_ipv6_routes

description.text: This is the name of the protocol stack as it appears in the GUI.
This is the name of the protocol stack as it appears in the GUI.
Activates the item

Enables the emulation of routes for IPv4 unicast. This option is mandatory if user wants to give a network_group_handle to bgp_route_config without creating a new network group. Learned routes filter is enabled at neighbor level for IxTclProcol, for IxTclNetwork the filters are set in emulation_bgp_config. The priority of the flags is the following VPN (L3 Sites), AD VPLS (L2 VPN), VPLS (L2 Sites), MPLS, Unicast/Multicast. Only one of the three route categories can be emulated in a single emulation_bgp_route_config call, the selection is made based on priority.

Enables the emulation of routes for IPv4 MPLS VPNs. Learned routes filter is enabled at neighbor level for IxTclProcol, for IxTclNetwork the filters are set in emulation_bgp_config. The priority of the flags is the following VPN (L3 Sites), AD VPLS (L2 VPN), VPLS (L2 Sites), MPLS, Unicast/Multicast. Only one of the three route categories can be emulated in a single emulation_bgp_route_config call, the selection is made based on priority. Requires parameter num_sites to be present in order to create VPN route ranges.

Enables the emulation of routes for IPv6 unicast. Learned routes filter is enabled at neighbor level for IxTclProcol, for IxTclNetwork the filters are set in emulation_bgp_config. The priority of the flags is the following VPN (L3 Sites), AD VPLS (L2 VPN), VPLS (L2 Sites), MPLS, Unicast/Multicast. Only one of the three route categories can be emulated in a single emulation_bgp_route_config call, the selection is made based on priority.

Enables the emulation of routes for IPv6 MPLS VPNs. Learned routes filter is enabled at neighbor level for IxTclProcol, for IxTclNetwork the filters are set in emulation_bgp_config. The priority of the flags is the following VPN (L3 Sites), AD VPLS (L2 VPN), VPLS (L2 Sites), MPLS, Unicast/Multicast. Only one of the three route categories can be emulated in a single emulation_bgp_route_config call, the selection is made based on priority. Requires parameter num_sites to be present in order to create VPN route ranges.
The number of route ranges, mpls route ranges, vpn routes to create under the BGP neighbor or the number of label blocks to create under the BGP neighbor when VPLS is enabled.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri or vpls_nlri

description.text: The IP version of the BGP route to be created.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Route prefix to be advertised / removed by emulated BGP node.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: IP address increment step between the multiple route ranges created under the BGP neighbor, based on -max_route_ranges.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Number of routes to advertise, using the prefix as the starting prefix and incrementing based upon the -prefix_step and the -netmask arguments.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Number of L2/L3 VPN sites (PEs) to be created on a BGP neighbor.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri or vpls_nlri

description.text: The first prefix length to generate based on the -prefix.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Netmask of the advertised routes.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: IPv6 mask for the IPv6 routes advertised.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: The minimum number of routes to pack into an UPDATE message. Random numbers are chosen from the range -packing_from to -packing_to.

description.text: The maximum number of routes to pack into an UPDATE message. Random numbers are chosen from the range -packing_from to -packing_to.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: If checked, use the traditional NLRI in the UPDATE message, instead of using the MP_REACH_NLRI Multi-protocol extension to advertise the routes. (Not applicable for MPLS and MPLS VPN Route Ranges.)

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: A flag to enable the generation of a NEXT HOP attribute. Can be used as a flag of a choice of 0 or 1.

description.text: Indicates how to set the next hop IP address.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: The type of IP address in nextHopIpAddress.

description.text: Specifies a mandatory path attribute that defines the IP address of the border router that should be used as the next hop to the destinations listed in the Network Layer Reachability field of the UPDATE message.

description.text: Specifies a mandatory path attribute that defines the IP address of the border router that should be used as the next hop to the destinations listed in the Network Layer Reachability field of the UPDATE message. Has priority over the legacy -next_hop parameter.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Specifies a mandatory path attribute that defines the IP address of the border router that should be used as the next hop to the destinations listed in the Network Layer Reachability field of the UPDATE message. Has priority over the legacy -next_hop parameter.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Advertise Nexthop as V4

A flag to define whether to enable the origin route or not.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Enable Weight
Weight

Specifies the ATOMIC_AGGREGATE path attribute, which is a discretionary attribute. If set to 1, informs other BGP speakers that the local system selected a less specific route without selecting a more specific route included in it.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: For the AGGREGATOR path attribute, specifies the IP address of the BGP speaker that formed the aggregate route. Has priority over the legacy -aggregator parameter.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: For the AGGREGATOR path attribute, specifies the last AS number that formed the aggregate route. Has priority over the legacy -aggregator parameter.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Specifies the ORIGINATOR_ID path attribute, which is an optional, non-transitive BGP attribute. It is created by a Route Reflector and carries the ROUTER_ID of the originator of the route in the local AS.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: During flapping operation, the time between flap cycles, expressed in seconds. During this period, the route range will be up.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: During flapping operation, the period expressed in seconds during which the route is withdrawn from its neighbors.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: FLAG - Enable partial flapping functions.

description.text: When partial route flapping is enabled, gives the index of the route which to end the flap.

description.text: Flapping delay

description.text: Internal mapping to implicit list length param

Specifies the COMMUNITIES path attribute, which is an optional transitive attribute of variable length. All routes with this attribute belong to the communities listed in the attribute. This is a list of numbers.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Type

restriction.value: no_export no_advertised no_export_subconfed manual llgr_stale no_llgr

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Enables or disables Large communities.
Internal mapping to implicit list length param
Large Community in cannonical format as defined in RFC8092 which is: GlobalAdmin:LocalDataPart1:LocalDataPart2 where each value must have range 1-4294967295. e.g. 65535:100:10 or 4294967295:1:65535
Enable Extended Community

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Internal mapping to implicit list length param

Specifies the EXTENDED COMMUNITIES path attribute, which is a transitive optional BGP attribute. All routes with the EXTENDED COMMUNITIES attribute belong to the communities listed in the attribute.

This is a list of numbers separated by comma char "," as follows:

The first number is the value of the low-order type byte. Possible values:

  1. 0 - (default)

  2. 2 - Route target community
  3. 3 - Route origin community
  4. 4 - Link bandwidth community

The second number is the value of the high-order type byte. Possible values:

  1. 128 - IANA bit: This bit may be or'd with any other values. 0 indicates that this is an IANA assignable type using First Come First Serve policy. 1 indicates that this is an IANA assignable type using the IETF Consensus policy.
  1. 64 - Transitive bit: This bit may be or'd with any other values. 0 indicates that the community is transitive across ASes and 1 indicates that it is non-transitive.
  1. 0 - Two-octet AS specific (default): Value holds a two-octet global ASN followed by a four-bytes local admin value.

  2. 1 - IPv4 address specific: Value holds a four-octet IP address followed by a two-bytes local administrator value.
  3. 2 - Four-octet AS specific: Value holds a four-octet global ASN followed by a two-bytes local admin value.
  4. 3 - Generic: Value holds six-octets.
  5. The third number is the value associated with the extended community. (default = {00 00 00 00 00 00})

Example value: {2,128,03 22 00 00 00 00}.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: AS 2-Bytes

Specifies the CLUSTER_LIST path attribute, which is an optional, non-transitive BGP attribute. It is a sequence of CLUSTER_ID values representing the reflection path through which the route has passed.

Increment value used to step the base label.

Type of AS Segment generated. If user selects Random, then any of the four types (AS-SET, AS-SEQ, AS-SET-CONFEDERATION, AS-SEQ-CONFEDERATION) will get randomly generated

restriction.value: as_set as_seq as_set_confederation as_seq_confederation random_segments random_between_asset_and_asseq

description.text: Maximum Number Of AS Numbers generated per Segment
Minimum Number Of AS Numbers generated per Segments

Supported Formats: value value1-value2 Values or value ranges separated by comma(,). e.g. 100,150-200,400,600-800 etc. Cannot be kept empty. Should be >= ((Max Number of AS Path Segments) x (Max AS Numbers Per Segment))

When there are multiple routes in a route range, this option decides whether to use same or different AS paths randomly generated for all the routes within that route range. For the Different option, each route will be sent in different update messages.
Seed value decides the way the AS Values are generated. To generate different AS Paths for different Route ranges, select unique Seed Values
This parameter indicates that as_path attributes are to be generated.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Number of AS_Path Segments Per Route Range
For External routing only. Optional setup for the AS-Path.

choice.choiceText: Prepend Local AS to first segment

restriction.value: include_as_seq include_as_seq_conf include_as_set include_as_set_conf no_include prepend_as

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Specifies the AS_PATH path attribute, which is a mandatory attribute composed of a sequence of AS path segments. Format: <as path type>:<comma separated segment list> {as_set|as_seq|as_confed_set|as_confed_seq}:<x,x,x,x>. Example: as_set:1,2,3,4 as_set - specifies an unordered set of autonomous systems though which a route in the UPDATE message has traversed. as_seq - specifies an ordered set of autonomous systems through which a route in the UPDATE message has traversed. as_confed_set - specifies an unordered set of autonomous systems in the local confederation that the UPDATE message has traversed. as_confed_seq - specifies an ordered set of autonomous systems in the local confederation that the UPDATE message has traversed. DEFAULT = as_set:<router_as>, where <router_as> is the AS of the router which advertises this route.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Specifies the segment type for the AS_PATH attribute. This may be a list of values with equal length to the as_path parameter list.

restriction.argumentId: ipv4/6_unicast_nlri or ipv4/6_multicast_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_nlri or ipv4/6_mpls_vpn_nlri

description.text: Numbers of AS numbers in the AS_PATH segment.
Enable AS Path Segment
Enable AS Number
A list of lists of AS_PATH segment numbers. The outer list length needs to match as_path_segment_type list length.

description.text: (deprecated) This BGP/BGP+ router/peer supports BGP/BGP+ VPLS per the Kompella draft. This will enable the L2 Sites. Does not take priority over other flags that enable L3 sites and AD VPLS. The priority of the flags is the following VPN (L3 Sites), AD VPLS (L2 VPN), VPLS (L2 Sites), MPLS, Unicast/Multicast.

This BGP/BGP+ router/peer supports BGP/BGP+ VPLS per the Kompella draft. This will enable the L2 Sites. Does not take priority over other flags that enable L3 sites and AD VPLS. The priority of the flags is the following VPN (L3 Sites), AD VPLS (L2 VPN), VPLS (L2 Sites), MPLS, Unicast/Multicast.
Starting value of the administrator field of the route distinguisher.

Starting value of the assigned number field of the route distinguisher.

description.text: Inner increment value to step the base route distinguisher assigned number field if -target_count is greater than 1.
Enable Control Word
Enable Sequenced Delivery
Maximum transmit unit. Has to be in concordance with the DUT settings.
The current L2 site identifier.
Increment for the L2 site identifier.
AS number or IP address list based on the -target_type list.

description.text: VPN Name
Advertise Label Block

choice.choiceText: Specifies that the num_labels parameter is a list and shouldnt be multiplied
Specifies that the num_labels parameter is a single value and should be used a number of times equal to max_route_ranges

description.text: The offset of the label block.
Type of the -label_block_offset parameter. Default value is single_value.

choice.choiceText: Specifies that the label_block_offset parameter is a list and shouldnt be multiplied
Specifies that the label_block_offset parameter is a single value and should be used a number of times equal to max_route_ranges

description.text: Type of the -label_value parameter. If this parameter is set to list "-label_value_step" is ignored. Default value is single_value.

Specifies that the label_value parameter is a single value and should be used a number of times equal to max_route_ranges

A list containing individual interface, session and/or router handles that were added by the command (if any). Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.

notes.note: Coded versus functional specification. 1) You can configure multiple BGP route range on each Ixia interface. If the current session or command was run with -return_detailed_handles 0 the following keys will be omitted from the command response: bgp_routes, bgp_sites, broadcast_domain_handles, broadcast_domain_vpws_handles, broadcast_domain_vxlan_vpws_handles

code_examples.example:
# Command :- ::ixiangpf::emulation_bgp_route_config
# This example will configure a network group/route range for BGP router used
set network_group_1_status [::ixiangpf::emulation_bgp_route_config \ -handle <bgp_handle> \ -mode create \ -max_route_ranges 5 \ -ip_version 4 \ -prefix 121.12.12.1 \ -num_routes 13 \ -prefix_from 24 \ -flap_delay 0 \ -flap_down_time 0 \ ]
# The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1} {network_group_handle networkGroupHandle} # {macpool_ip_prefix prefixPools} # {ip_routes bgpIpRouteProperty} # {bgp_routes {bgpRoutes}}]
This example will configure a route range for when BGP SR is in use
set network_groupv4_bgp_status [::ixiangpf::emulation_bgp_route_config \ -mode add \ -handle <bgp_handle> \ -ip_version 4 \ -advertise_as_bgp_3107_sr 1 \ -segmentId 500 \ -incrementMode increment \ -specialLabel includeexplicitipv4null \ -enableSRGB 0 \ ]
# The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1} {network_group_handle networkGroupHandle} # {macpool_ip_prefix ipv4Prefixpools} # {ip_routes bgpIPRouteProperty} # {bgp_routes bgpRoutes}
